p: Natural killer (NK) cells are at the front line in controlling virus replication via stimulation of IFN-I. Like other viruses, CHIKV is able to induce the activation of a phenotype rarely seen in the NK cells of healthy patients; these cells have the NKG2C1 receptor activated, which makes them highly cytotoxic, leading to the lysis of infected cells ( Petitdemange et al., 2011).
